name: Aztecs
description:
Infantry and Monk civilization

- Villagers carry +3
- Military units created 11% faster
- +5 Monk hit points for each Monastery technology
- Start with +50 gold

Team Bonus:
Relics generate +33% gold

name: Bengalis
description:
Elephant and Naval civilization

- Elephant units receive 25% less bonus damage and are more resistant to conversion
- Town Centers spawn 2 Villagers when the next Age is reached
- Cavalry +2 attack vs. Skirmishers
- Ships regenerate 15 HP per minute
- Monks +3/+3P armor

Team Bonus:
Trade units yield 10% food in addition to gold

name: Berbers
description:
Cavalry and Naval civilization

- Villagers move 5% faster in Dark Age, 10% starting in Feudal Age
- Stable units cost -15% in Castle, -20% in Imperial Age
- Ships move 10% faster

Team Bonus:
Genitour available in the Archery Range starting in the Castle Age

name: Bohemians
description:
Gunpowder and Monk civilization

- Blacksmiths and Universities cost -100 wood
- Chemistry and Hand Cannoneer available in Castle Age
- Spearman-line deals +25% bonus damage
- Fervor and Sanctity affect Villagers
- Mining Camp technologies free

Team Bonus:
Markets work 80% faster

name: Britons
description:
Foot Archer civilization

- Town Centers cost -50% wood starting in the Castle Age
- Foot archers (except skirmishers) +1 range in Castle and Imperial Age (+2 total)
- Shepherds work 25% faster

Team Bonus:
Archery Ranges work 10% faster

name: Bulgarians
description:
Infantry and Cavalry civilization

- Militia-line upgrades free
- Town Centers cost -50% stone
- Blacksmith and Siege Workshop technologies cost -50% food
- Can build Krepost

Team Bonus:
Blacksmiths work 80% faster

name: Burgundians
description:
Cavalry civilization

- Economic upgrades available one age earlier and cost -33% food
- Stable technologies cost -50%
- Cavalier upgrade available in Castle Age
- Gunpowder units +25% attack

Team Bonus:
Relics generate both Gold & Food

name: Burmese
description:
Monk and Elephant civilization

- Lumber Camp technologies free
- Infantry +1 attack per age (starting in the Feudal Age)
- Battle Elephants +1/+1P armor
- Monastery technologies cost -50%

Team Bonus:
Relics visible on the map at the start of the game

name: Byzantines
description:
Defensive civilization

- Buildings +10% HP Dark, +20% Feudal, +30% Castle, +40% Imperial Age
- Camel Riders, Skirmishers, Pikemen, Halberdiers cost -25%
- Fire Ships and Dromons attack 25% faster
- Advance to Imperial Age costs -33%
- Town Watch, Town Patrol free

Team Bonus:
Monks +100% heal speed

name: Celts
description:
Infantry and Siege civilization

- Infantry move 15% faster (starting in the Feudal Age)
- Lumberjacks work 15% faster
- Siege weapons fire 25% faster
- Can steal sheep, and sheep within one Celt unit's LoS cannot be stolen

Siege Workshops work 20% faster

name: Chinese
description:
Archer civilization

- Start with +3 villagers, -50 wood, -200 food
- Technologies cost -5% Feudal,
-10% Castle, -15% Imperial Age
- Town Centers support 15 population and +7 LOS
- Demolition ships +50% hit points

Team Bonus:
Farms +10% food

name: Cumans
description:
Cavalry civilization

- Additional Town Center can be built in the Feudal Age
- Siege Workshop and Battering Ram available in the Feudal Age; Capped Ram upgrade available in Castle Age
- Archery Ranges and Stables cost -75 wood
- Cavalry 5% faster each age (starting in Feudal Age)

Team Bonus:
Palisade Walls +33% HP

name: Dravidians
description:
Infantry and Naval civilization

- Receive +200 wood when advancing to the next age
- Fishermen and Fishing Ships carry +15
- Barracks technologies cost -50%
- Siege weapons cost -33% wood
- Skirmishers and Elephant Archers attack 25% faster

Team Bonus:
Docks provide +5 population room

name: Ethiopians
description:
Archer civilization

- Archers fire 18% faster
- Receive +100 gold, +100 food when advancing to the next age
- Pikeman upgrade free

Team Bonus:
Outposts +3 line of sight and cost no stone

name: Franks
description:
Cavalry civilization

- Castles cost -15% in Castle, -25% in Imperial Age
- Cavalry +20% hit points starting in Feudal Age
- Mill technologies free
- Foragers work 15% faster

Team Bonus:
Knights +2 line of sight

name: Goths
description:
Infantry civilization

- Infantry cost -20% in Dark, -25% in Feudal, -30% in Castle, -35% in Imperial Age
- Infantry +1 attack vs. buildings per age (starting from Feudal Age)
- Villagers +5 attack vs. wild boar; hunters carry +15 meat; hunt lasts 20% longer
- Loom can be researched instantly
- +10 population in Imperial Age

Barracks work 20% faster

name: Gurjaras
description:
Cavalry and Camel civilization

- Start with 2 Forage Bushes
- Can garrison Mills with livestock to produce food
- Mounted units deal +20% bonus damage Feudal, +30% Castle, +40% Imperial Age
- Can garrison Docks with Fishing Ships

Team Bonus:
Camel and elephant units created 25% faster

name: Huns
description:
Cavalry civilization

- Do not need houses, but start with -100 wood
- On Nomadic maps, the first Town Center spawns a Hunnic Horse
- Cavalry Archers cost -10% Castle, -20% Imperial Age
- Trebuchets +30% accuracy

Team Bonus:
Stables work 20% faster

name: Incas
description:
Infantry civilization

- Military units food cost -10% Dark, -15% Feudal, -20% Castle, -25% Imperial Age
- Villagers affected by Blacksmith upgrades starting in the Castle Age
- Houses support 10 population
- Buildings cost -15% stone

Team Bonus:
Start with a free Llama

name: Hindustanis
description:
Camel and Gunpowder civilization
-Villagers cost -8% Dark, -13% Feudal, -18% Castle, -23% Imperial Age
-Camel Riders attack 20% faster
-Gunpowder units +1/+1P armor
-Can build Caravanserai in Imperial Age

Team Bonus:
Camel and light cavalry units +2 attack vs. buildings

name: Italians
description:
Archer and Naval civilization

- Advancing to the next age costs -15%
- Dock and University technologies cost -33%
- Fishing Ships cost -15%
- Gunpowder units cost -20%

Team Bonus:
Condottiero available in the Barracks in Imperial Age

name: Japanese
description:
Infantry civilization

- Fishing Ships 2x hit points; +2P armor; work rate +5% Dark, +10% Feudal, +15% Castle, +20% Imperial Age
- Mill, Lumber/Mining Camps cost -50%
- Infantry attack 33% faster starting in Feudal Age
- Cavalry Archers +2 attack vs. Archers

Team Bonus:
Galleys +50% line of sight

name: Khmer
description:
Siege and Elephant civilization

- No buildings required to advance to the next age or to unlock other buildings
- Farmers don't require Mills/Town Centers to drop off food
- Battle Elephants move 10% faster
- Villagers can garrison in Houses

Team Bonus:
Scorpions +1 range

name: Koreans
description:
Defensive and Naval civilization

- Villagers +3 line of sight
- Stone miners work 20% faster
- Archer Armor and Tower upgrades free (Bombard Tower requires Chemistry)
- Archers and Infantry cost -50% wood
- Warships cost -20% wood

Team Bonus:
Mangonel-line minimum range reduced

name: Lithuanians
description:
Cavalry and Monk civilization

- Each Town Center provides 100 food
- Spearman-line and Skirmishers move 10% faster
- Each garrisoned relic gives +1 attack to Knights and Leitis (maximum +4)

Team Bonus:
Monasteries work 20% faster

name: Magyars
description:
Cavalry civilization

- Villagers kill wolves with 1 strike
- Forging, Iron Casting, Blast Furnace free
- Scout Cavalry, Light Cavalry, Hussar cost -15%

Team Bonus:
Cavalry Archers created 25% faster

name: Malay
description:
Naval civilization

- Advancing to the next age 66% faster
- Fish Traps cost -33% and provide 3X food
- Battle Elephants cost -30% in Castle, -40% in Imperial Age
- Infantry armor upgrades free

Team Bonus:
Docks +100% line of sight

name: Malians
description:
Infantry civilization

- Buildings cost -15% wood
- Barracks units +1P armor per age (starting from Feudal Age)
- Villagers drop off 10% more gold

Team Bonus:
Universities work 80% faster

name: Mayans
description:
Archer civilization

- Start with +1 villager, but -50 food
- Resources last 15% longer
- Archers cost -10% Feudal, -20% Castle, -30% Imperial Age

Team Bonus:
Walls cost -50%

name: Mongols
description:
Cavalry Archer civilization

- Cavalry archers fire 25% faster
- Light Cavalry, Hussars, Steppe Lancers +30% hit points
- Hunters work 40% faster

Team Bonus:
Scout Cavalry, Light Cavalry, Hussar +2 line of sight

name: Persians
description:
Cavalry civilization

- Start with +50 wood, food
- Town Center, Dock 2x hit points; work rate +5% Dark, +10% Feudal, +15% Castle, +20% Imperial Age
- Parthian Tactics available in Castle Age
- Can build Caravanserai in Imperial Age

Team Bonus:
Knights +2 attack vs. Archers

name: Poles
description:
Cavalry civilization

- Villagers regenerate 10 HP per minute in Feudal, 15 in Castle, 20 in Imperial Age
- Folwark replaces Mill
- Stone Miners generate gold in addition to stone

Team Bonus:
Scout Cavalry, Light Cavalry, Hussar +1 attack vs. Archers

name: Portuguese
description:
Naval and Gunpowder civilization

- All units cost -20% gold
- Foragers generate wood in addition to food
- Ships +10% HP
- Can build Feitoria in Imperial Age

Team Bonus:
Technologies researched 25% faster

name: Saracens
description:
Camel and Naval civilization

- Market trade cost only 5%
- Markets cost -100 wood
- Transport Ships 2x hit points,
2x carry capacity
- Galleys attack 25% faster
- Camel units +25% hit points

Team Bonus:
Foot archers +2 attack vs. buildings

name: Sicilians
description:
Infantry and Cavalry civilization

- Start with +100 stone
- Castles built 50%, Town Centers built 100% faster
- Land military units (except siege weapons) receive 33% less bonus damage
- Farm upgrades provide +125% additional food
- Donjon replaces Watch Tower-line

Team Bonus:
Transport Ships +5 line of sight and cost -50%

name: Slavs
description:
Infantry and Siege civilization

- Farmers work 15% faster
- Supplies, Gambesons free
- Siege Workshop units 15% cheaper
- Monks move 20% faster

Team Bonus:
Military buildings provide +5 population room

name: Spanish
description:
Gunpowder and Monk civilization

- Builders work 30% faster
- Blacksmith upgrades don't cost gold
- Cannon Galleons benefit from Ballistics (fire faster, more accurately)
- Gunpowder units fire 18% faster
- Receive +20 gold for each technology researched

Team Bonus:
Trade units generate +25% gold

name: Tatars
description:
Cavalry Archer civilization

- Villagers gather +50% food from herdables
- New Town Centers spawn 2 Sheep starting in the Castle Age
- Units deal +25% damage when fighting from higher elevation
- Thumb Ring, Parthian Tactics free

Team Bonus:
Cavalry Archers +2 line of sight

name: Teutons
description:
Infantry civilization

- Monks healing range 2x
- Towers garrison 2x units
- Murder Holes, Herbal Medicine free
- Farms cost -40%
- Town Center garrison +10
- Barracks and Stable units +1 armor in Castle and Imperial Age (+2 total)

Team Bonus:
Units resist conversion

name: Turks
description:
Gunpowder civilization

- Gunpowder units +25% hit points; researching gunpowder technologies costs -50%; Chemistry free
- Gold miners work 20% faster
- Scout Cavalry, Light Cavalry, Hussar +1P armor
- Light Cavalry and Hussar upgrades free

Team Bonus:
Gunpowder units created 25% faster

name: Vietnamese
description:
Archer civilization

- Enemy positions are revealed at the start of the game
- Economic upgrades cost no wood and research 100% faster
- Archery Range units +20% HP
- Conscription free

Team Bonus:
Imperial Skirmisher upgrade available in the Imperial Age

name: Vikings
description:
Infantry and Naval civilization

- Warships cost -15% Feudal Age, -15% Castle Age, -20% Imperial Age
- Infantry +20% hit points starting in Feudal Age
- Wheelbarrow, Hand Cart free

Team Bonus:
Docks cost -15%

name: Romans
description:
Infantry civilization

- Villagers gather, build, and repair 5% faster
- Galley-line and Dromons +1/+1P armor
- Infantry receives double effect from Blacksmith armor upgrades
- Scorpions cost -60% gold and benefit from Ballistics research

Team Bonus:
Scorpion-line minimum range reduced

name: Armenians
description:
Infantry and Naval civilization

-Mule Carts cost -25%
-Mule Cart technologies are 40% more effective
-First Fortified Church receives a free Relic
-Non-unique Barracks units (except Men-at-Arms) available one age earlier
-Galley-line and Dromons fire an additional projectile

Team Bonus:
Infantry +2 line of sight

name: Georgians
description:
Defensive and Cavalry civilization

-Start with a Mule Cart
-Fortified Churches provide Villagers in an 8 tile radius with +10% work rate
-Units and buildings receive -15% damage when fighting from higher elevation
-Cavalry regenerates 5 HP per minute in Feudal, 10 in Castle, 15 in Imperial Age

Team Bonus:
Buildings cost 25% fewer resources to repair
